fields.headline: Bannon booted from security council
fields.bodyText: The White House’s chief strategist, Steve Bannon, was removed from the national security council, where he’d been controversially installed, though he reportedly did not lose his security clearances. Fox News reported that Trump “wasn’t particularly happy … ” Bannon off NSC Donald Trump said “my attitude toward Syria and Assad has changed very much” after a chemical attack there, which he said “crossed a lot of lines for me”. But Trump declined to describe his new attitude or articulate a policy. Read our coverage I will tell you that attack on children yesterday had a big impact on me – big impact. My attitude toward Syria and Assad has changed very much … You’re now talking about a whole different level. – Donald Trump It might take just a minute to catch up on the latest politics news. Become a Guardian member The president sprang to the defense of Bill O’Reilly, as dozens of advertisers fled the Fox host’s show following revelations that O’Reilly had been involved in five settlements with women who said he had harassed them. Personally, I think he shouldn’t have settled. Because you should have taken it all the way; I don’t think Bill did anything wrong … I think he’s a person I know well – he is a good person. – Donald Trump, in an interview with the New York Times, on Bill O’Reilly Citing zero evidence, Trump told the New York Times that he thought the former national security adviser Susan Rice had committed a crime in handling intelligence possibly related to Trump transition figures. “Do I think?” Trump said. “Yes, I think.” Read the piece
